automationWelcomeGuidedTourStep.title: Welcome to Baserow Automations!
automationWelcomeGuidedTourStep.content: Let's take a quick tour. You'll see how to set up triggers, add actions, test your workflow, and publish it â€” no coding required.

automationGraphGuidedTourStep.title: Manage your workflow graph here
automationGraphGuidedTourStep.content: Create a trigger and actions here to define what the workflow should do. Select a trigger or action to configure it in the side panel.

automationTestRunGuidedTourStep.title: Test your workflow
automationTestRunGuidedTourStep.content: When you're ready, start a test run to see your workflow in action. The trigger will run once to simulate a full execution.

automationHistoryGuidedTourStep.title: View workflow history
automationHistoryGuidedTourStep.content: Use the history panel to review past test runs and published executions. It's a great way to debug or confirm results.

automationPublishGuidedTourStep.title: Publish your workflow
automationPublishGuidedTourStep.content: Once you've tested and refined your setup, publish your workflow to make it live. Its trigger will now run automatically on schedule.

automationWorkflowStateGuidedTourStep.title: Control workflow state
automationWorkflowStateGuidedTourStep.content: From here, you can pause or resume your workflow at any time. You're always in control of whether it's active or disabled.

automationDocsGuidedTourStep.title: Explore the documentation
automationDocsGuidedTourStep.content: If you ever get stuck or want to learn more, click the highlighted button for detailed guides and FAQs about building automations in Baserow.

automationWorkflowErrors.errorNameNotUnique: A workflow with this name already exists
automationWorkflowErrors.errorNameNotUniqueDescription: Please enter a unique name for the workflow

generalSettings.notificationCheckboxLabel: Get notified when this automation fails
generalSettings.cantUpdateAutomationDescription: Sorry, could not update the automation.

integrationSettings.title: Integrations
integrationSettings.noIntegrationMessage: You have not yet created any integrations. They can be created by adding data source, action or user authentication.
integrationSettings.integrationMessage: You can create new integrations by adding data source, action or user authentication.

historySidePanel.title: History
historySidePanel.noRunsDescription: When this workflow has run, the results will be shown here.

nodeType.triggerDeletionError: Triggers cannot be deleted, only replaced.
nodeType.routerWithOutputNodesDeleteError: Cannot be deleted until its {outputCount} output nodes are removed.
nodeType.routerWithOutputNodesReplaceError: Cannot be replaced until its {outputCount} output nodes are removed.
nodeType.iteratorWithChildrenNodesDeleteError: Cannot be deleted until its child nodes are removed.
nodeType.iteratorWithChildrenNodesReplaceError: Cannot be replaced until its child nodes are removed.

serviceType.periodicTriggerDescription: Triggers the workflow on a periodic basis at specified intervals
serviceType.coreHTTPTriggerDescription: Receive HTTP requests to trigger workflows

periodicTriggerServiceForm.intervalHelper: Choose how frequently you want this workflow to run
periodicTriggerServiceForm.minuteHelper: This workflow will run every minute
periodicTriggerServiceForm.hourHelper: This workflow will run every hour at the specified minute in your local timezone ({timezone})
periodicTriggerServiceForm.dayHelper: This workflow will run every day at the specified time in your local timezone ({timezone})
periodicTriggerServiceForm.weekHelper: This workflow will run every week on the specified day and time in your local timezone ({timezone})
periodicTriggerServiceForm.monthHelper: This workflow will run every month on the specified day and time in your local timezone ({timezone})
periodicTriggerServiceForm.deactivatedText: This periodic trigger has been automatically deactivated due to consecutive failures.

simulateDispatch.triggerNodeAwaitingEvent: The node is waiting. Please manually trigger the event to populate the payload and complete the test.
simulateDispatch.errorNodeNotConfigured: The node must be configured before it can be tested.
simulateDispatch.errorPreviousNodeNotConfigured: The previous node "{node}" must be configured.
simulateDispatch.errorPreviousNodesNotTested: The previous node "{node}" must be tested first.
simulateDispatch.testNodeDescription: Test this event to confirm the configuration is correct. Data from this test can be used in later steps.
